meanings.definition: A system of government in which a single person holds absolute power.
meanings.sent1: In autarchies, one individual has complete control over the government.
meanings.sent2: The autarchies in history often led to tyranny and oppression.
meanings.sent3: The autarchies of old tales were always portrayed as ruthless rulers.
meanings.sent4: The autarchies of power can sometimes corrupt even the most well-intentioned leaders.
meanings.sent5: The concept of autarchies is a cautionary tale about the dangers of unchecked authority.

meanings.definition: The state of self-sufficiency or self-rule.
meanings.sent1: Living in autarchies means relying only on oneself for everything.
meanings.sent2: The community aimed to achieve autarchies by growing their own food and producing their own goods.
meanings.sent3: The idea of autarchies may sound appealing, but it requires a lot of hard work.
meanings.sent4: In a world of interdependence, true autarchies seem like a distant dream.
meanings.sent5: The pursuit of autarchies can lead to a sense of empowerment and freedom.
